WRITING.TITLE: Stop calling me orange! IMPEACH!
When your dog looks into your soul and asks "WHY?"
What so you get when you mix a Lab with a Taiwanese Mountain Dog?? You get this 40 pound stunner!
Lymph nodes on dogs neck varing in size, combined with very bad breathe.
WRITING.TEXT: -Dog -Female -3 years old -Mixed breed: Labrador / formosan mountain dog -Approx 42 pounds -Rescued 1.5 years ago from Taiwan now lives in Toronto Canada. -Varying size in nodes has been going on about 1 year. Bad breath about 6 months. -history of food allergies to beef, chicken, lamb, fish. Now on raynes kanagroo low fat dry food and doing very well. Symptoms of allergies would be ear infections, hair loss, and discolored/ scabby skin. 1. So Ive always been able to feel the lymph nodes on my dogs neck but I did always notice they could vary in size from day to day but in the last 6 months ive noticed that the lymph nodes are consistently quite large and even though I do feel a difference in size from day to day sometimes , I notice its not going to back to a smaller size like it used to. Its always pretty large. Feels like half a golf ball in both sides of her neck ( under her ears) . Both lymph nodes seem to match each other in size. 2. When i got my dog she didnt have the greatest teeth. 1 year ago i got them professionally clean and some teeth extracted. I have found it difficult to keep her teeth clean since as it seems the tartar just keeps building up even with brushing. The last 6 months have been a bit alarming as her breathe has been VERY bad and even after brushing I can still smell it. 3. She recently had to go on a round of antibiotics for infected anal glands. I dont know if they were infected for sure but I guess the doctor was being cautious. The reason ive linked the lymph nodes with the bad breath is because when on the antibiotics her lymph nodes shrunk dramatically to where I couldn't really feel them while petting her anymore and her bad breath got better! When she went off the antibiotics ive noticed her nodes slowly getting bigger and her bad breathe coming back. When i last went to the vet she was only a few days off the antibiotics so I was told to monitor. The vet was thinking if I came back she would test for tonsillitis. So my question is what does this sound like to you? Does it sound like it could be tonsillitis or something else? What kind of tests should I do? Is there anything I could do with food or oral care that may remedy this that I can try without doing expensive testing. Overall my dog seems happy and healthy. No signs to me of illness. Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone feel really run down when they have a really bad flare.
WRITING.TEXT: I have HS pretty much nonstop. I always have a few spots going but once in a while Ill get a really bad flare where either the wound is extra bad or I flare up badly im multiple places. Its always tiring to be going about your day hurting but when I have these really bad flare ups I mean I feel sick! I don't know if I flair up because im getting sick and my immune system is down or if I flare up and cause my immune system to go down and I catch a cold. But I have a particularly angry one right now and my throat hurts, i have aches and pains, feels like im about to fever, i feel like im fighting something else off and Im also feeling really moody like i want to cry. Anyone else get this where it feels like your fighting an infection?

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] Am I a bad owner? Sometimes I think my dog would have been better off adopted by someone else.
WRITING.TEXT: Today my dog ran out of the house and got hit by a car. They think she is going to be okay but she is still not completely out of the woods and she has a terrible wound she will have to recovery from. I recently moved back in with my mom due to health issues and my dog came with me. We used to have 4 cats so she knows the deal with doors n stuff but this is the 2nd time she left the door wide open and my dog ran out. Because of my fear of this I have been trying to train her. She will stay if we tell her to but my mom didnt she just left the door open. Ive also been to recall training and working on it with her everyday. Even have her on a long leash now and she comes running to me whenever I call but when she gets out of the house she is sooo excited she just runs around and thinks its fun but has no fear of the road or cars. Ive let her off leash a few times and she just doesnt listen. Shes so excited, and wants to explore everything, shell come eventually but not when she has that initial rush. She was a rescue from taiwan so I guess shes a little more wild than other dogs but I cant help but think im not a good enough owner. That i havent worked hard enough to train her or spent enough money to do it. Is this common with dogs? Even if their trained to run off? Are some dogs just not ever able to be off leash? I feel so guilty and just feel like she would have been better off with someone else and shes an absolute sweetheart and adorable. Im sure someone else would have rescued her. Maybe it was selfish of me. I just dont know what to do Im just racked with guilt.

WRITING.TITLE: Dog had surgery on her abdomen.Found this surgical outfit on Amazon to help cover the surgery sight.She can pee and poo without taking it off and once she is a little more healed it will allow us to take off the cone sooner as she wont be able to lick the wound. Its been so helpful. Thought Id share
Emergency rooms are not for colds!
WRITING.TEXT: I am sitting in the hospital and literally 90% of the people here are adults with colds or kids with colds. Everyone here is bright eyed,on their phones,laughing and talking as normal, noone here even seems that sick! If your kid can sit in an emergency room playing and eating Tim hortons they can do that at home! They are not that sick and can be seen by a walk in clinic today or tomorrow. Everyone here is clogging up the system. When did people stop hearing the EMERGENCY in Emergency room. This is not a walk in clinic. This is suppose to be life or death and serious injury shit. Im sitting here in real pain with likely moderate pancreatitis and these guys are here getting prescriptions filled for antibiotics and children's Tylenol. Have some respect for people and some brains. Your child or you are not dying of a cold. Unless they are vomiting profusely with a high temp they dont belong in the emergency room. Kids cough, and vomit, and get fevers. Its a normal part of being sick. Can you please google some damn home care remedies before you bring yourself or your kid to the hospital. All your doing is skyrocketing the wait time, annoying the hell outta doctors, and making more people sick. You are the reason our hospitals are going to shit and racking up 5-7 hr wait times. Edit: This post is about universal health care countries. The USA is a completely different system. In countries with universal health care there are loads of other options available for non-emergencies and for this reason having an emergency room wait 2-7 hours long is absolutely ridiculous and unnecessary in these countries.

WRITING.TITLE: I've completely lost my whole sense of self and I have no idea how to get it back
WRITING.TEXT: I'm experiencing the longest depression I've ever had. Going on 7 years now. I've been depressed so long that I don't even know who I am anymore. I have such an unhealthy hatred for myself that even when Im motivated to try to like myself I don't even know who that is anymore. I feel like I have no identity and I know thats common with BPD but I feel as though its often talked about like you act different depending on who your with and thats not what I mean. I think I used to have a pretty good idea of who I was but now I dont know how to be anything anymore. My head is so jumbled with noise I can't even try to think through it logically. I couldn't describe myself if I had to anymore. I just don't know how to go about building a personality again. It seems so weird to have to think about... What am i like? Who am I? What kind of person am I? What kind of things do I say? Ive isolated myself from so many people for so long I actually get overwhelmed by any conversations because I just dont know who I am enough to know how to respond. It sounds over exaggerated and like im overthinking it but I really feel like this hollow body that just has nothing in it and im genuinely asking... How do you make a self identify again?

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] What city in the world do you think have the most respectful dog owners i.e respecting leash laws, watching their dogs etc.
WRITING.TEXT: I moved from downtown Vancouver to suburban Toronto and have noticed a big difference in the behaviour of the owners here compared to Vancouver. Vancouver owners were generally great. Always had their dogs leashed unless in designated unleashed areas, watched and stayed close to their dogs while around others, corrected bad behaviour, and just seemed generally a lot more respectful to their fellow owner. Where I am now its the opposite and we've had so many run ins with bad dogs and careless owners that I cant go to the parks anymore and have anxiety everytime I take my dog out because I never know when we'll run into a badly behaved unleashed dog. I got my dog in Vancouver and it's just ruined the whole experience of having a dog since bringing her here. We stay in quite a bit now and its depressing. Just curious what places you've been/lived where the dog owner community is above par.

WRITING.TITLE: I've found eating dark chocolate helps reduce binges
WRITING.TEXT: I have been in a semi successful recovery period. I say semi because ive had a few slip ups along the way but have managed to reduce my binges significantly through quitting diets, not focusing on weight loss, and trying to eat a balance of foods. Because ive found success from not restricting ( ive lost 50 pounds) I still have some yummy food around the house like chocolate, cheese, pizza, and allow myself to eat it as i please which helps to avoid binging but I do have trigger foods that I try to avoid as the food itself can cause a binge. One of those for me is milk chocolate and other sugary foods. Ive been buying dark chocolate instead lately and ive noticed I dont binge it. I find it so strong that I actually get sick of it after a while and can only eat so much of it. Im eating a lot less and because it has less sugar I don't feel the regular physical consequences of eating chocolate ( like acne, headache, mood changes, triggering other cravings, etc). Don't get me wrong I could still binge on it if I was in a bad place but just thought its a good option for someone who's trigger are sweets. You still get to eat chocolate but it may not be as triggering as other foods.

WRITING.TITLE: What's something small that someone can do or does do for you that genuinely makes your life better?
Dermaplaning has made a huge difference in my skin post acne recovery
WRITING.TEXT: I was able to finally clear up my cystic acne after 10 years due to some diet changes. But the skin that was left was not nice. Dryness, redness ,scars, pigmentation, huge pours and textured skin. I was buying a ton of products for all of it and nothing seemed to make a difference until i dermaplaned. I decided to dermaplane because I could feel i had a ton of dead skin that chemical exfoliants just weren't taking off. I used the schick silk touch up tool to do it at home. It was actually incredibly easy. My face was very smooth and did look fresher after but It still wasn't as clear and texture free as I wanted it to be. Since then Ive been using my products religiously YTP cleanser, Vitamin C Oil, niacinimade, and retinol. I found that 3 weeks after doing the dermaplaning that my skin is starting to looking like healthy new skin again and i think its because the dermaplaning allowed the products to absorb better into my skin and actually work as needed. I dont have textured skin anymore my redness is gone and the pigmentation has reduced so Id endorse doing dermaplaing at home. You can get it done at and office as well where they do a much better thorough job but this was enough for what i needed. I dont know if id continue to do it. Cause its kind of like shaving your face but it gave my face a reset which i am greatful for. I am now on track to have clear beautiful skin and just though Id share my experience with it.

WRITING.TITLE: I am not a fan of BPD terminology like FP and Splitting. I think it can be a major hindrance in recovery
WRITING.TEXT: I think knowledge is power so I think it's great that people learn and understand the concept of "favourite person" and "splitting" but Ive noticed on this sub it can take on a life of its own. It goes from being just a word to describe an action to a word to describe all your problems. I think putting such strong emphasis on these terms especially when you label another human being with these things is detrimental. If you use the word FP to describe your boyfriend or friend you're taking away the humanity of that person. Instead of being a friend theyve become a product of your disorder. They are no longer just a friend with their own wants, needs, and wishes they are now an FP. A direct connection to your disorder and ultimately a determining factor in your happiness or misery. Of course everything they do is going to affect you if you've put that label on them. I'm not saying FPs aren't a thing but I also think many people experience strong feelings for people without it being disordered thinking and I think a lot of people experience bad feelings towards ppl when they let them down without it being disordered thinking. I think by labeling FPs you are sentencing that relationship to always be disordered instead of working to normalize it. Same idea goes for splitting. It's a term health professionals can use to describe a pattern of behaviour/thinking but not everything you experience as black and white will be a symptom of BPD. Lots of people see the world as black and white. Its a lesson many people have to learn and instead of combating this type of thinking I see people experiencing anxiety and stress because they see everything they do as splitting. The label causes more trouble then the actual issue. I personally think it would be beneficial to throw these terms out the window and just take each situation as they are. Use the appropriate DBT skills for the moment and forget the lables. I think its easier to hide behind a term to describe your behaviour then to just look at the situation as what it is and sort it out. I do not use these terms personally because I do not believe all my behaviours are BPD behaviours. I think many of my behaviours and emotions are valid and normal. I do believe by not falling into this label game with my emotions it is easier to normalize them and therefore more effectively deal with them as well as feel less judgement and shame towards myself. You are not borderline personality disorder. You are someone who has borderline personality disorder. Not every action, emotion, and thought you have is due to your disorder and I think labelling all our emotions with such strong BPD labels can leave you stuck in a world where you feel you are not normal and your emotions/actions are all problematic. This is not the case. Not the case at all.

WRITING.TITLE: [Discussion] Found a product that cured my dogs dry nose/hyperkeratosis
WRITING.TEXT: My dog had hyperkeratosis on the side of her nose for as long as I can remember. I tried a stick balm but she went nuts trying to wipe it off I think due to the scent. I got this organic product from amazon with no scent and I was shockingly surprised how quick and well it worked. For the first few days when I would rub it on she would lick it right off. That wasnt ideal but I was still seeing improvement. I changed to putting it on right before she ate and that did the trick. 5-6 days later it was completely cleared. She didnt have any reactions or tummy issues due to eating it. Its been a huge success and im just so happy with the results i thought id share. I know pugs and other breeds are susceptible to this issue my so i thought id share. I got it on Amazon. The name of the company is Over the Moon Pets and its Organic Dog Nose Balm. Im not affiliated with the company in any way. Just thought id share a good experience after a few bad ones with popular balm brands.

WRITING.TITLE: Proud of this accomplishment. Take the toy to bed. Next up... Put the toy away! #128515;
Almost relapsed due to sneaky disordered thinking. Don't fall into the trap!
WRITING.TEXT: I've been pretty successful with recovery for the last 7 months. I kicked it by giving up diets, stopped weighing myself, stopped obsessing about my weight, accepted the fact I was using food as an unhealthy coping mechanism for sadness, and just ate regularly with no restrictions. Today I almost had a relapse because my disordered thinking snuck up on me. I started weighing myself again just to see the progress I had made as I felt like I was loosing weight and I just wanted to see if I was. That somehow turned into weighing myself weekly just to keep tabs on if I was still loosing. Convincing myself it wasnt about loosing weight it was just curiosity. So without realising I was back to being focused on my weight. I should mention ive lost 60 pounds WITHOUT being focused on weight loss. Anyways its all fine until I weigh myself today and I didnt lose any weight this past week. That brought on an instant strong urge to binge. I was ready to say fuck it and give in after all this time. Luckily ive been at this a while and was very aware the eating disorder had snuck its way back. I understood the binge urge was related to the ultimate "failure" I felt by not loosing weight but on top of that I was so upset I had let myself fall into the trap again. It felt like I had control over the weighing because I wasnt doing it everyday and had simply convinced myself I didnt care about the weight. I know that weighing myself is a recipe for binging but after a while you start to think you have more control when you havent binged for so long. It sucks to know im just someone who cant do that without crashing and burning. I'm sad that i obviously still suffer with BED even if im not actively binging. I am thankful that ive learned the lesson so hopefully next time It wont happen. Just thought id share the experience as a cautionary tale of how something that seems so innocent can cause a relapse.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone else having difficulty viewing graphic wound pictures?
WRITING.TEXT: I absolutely appreciate people wanting to share their experience with HS. I think there is an appropriate place in this sub for sharing in this way but having extremely graphic wound photos show up on my feed makes me very uncomfortable considering I have no option whether i want to view them or not. They are just there. I have HS and have bad flares. Its not that we dont all know what they look like but people can have physical and psychological reactions to seeing such graphic content and id like to just suggest the mods put a blurred filter and graphic content label on the photos. This way people have the choice to click on the post and see the photo or to scroll by it if it makes them uncomfortable. I am in other HS groups on facebook that do this and I am suggesting we do this too. Ive noticed an uptick in this kind of content and would really appreciate it if I was given a choice whether to view or not. I live with this, i know its not pretty, and i know everyones just looking for support but I for one, and I know many others are very sensitive to graphic photos like this so I just ask the mods to put something in place so we can all feel comfortable when on the sub. If you agree it would be great if you could msg the mods as well or give this an upvote. Thank you. And i want to say very clearly im not singling anyone out nor do I think anyone did anything wrong. I think it's just a blind spot on this sub. I think people should absolutely keep posting whatever they like Im just requesting some options for those of us who have a tough time viewing images of a graphic nature.

WRITING.TITLE: Herbivores Blue Tansy Resurfacing mask has saved my skin!
WRITING.TEXT: I just tried Herbivores Blue Tansy Resurfacing Mask from Sephora and my god seriously the results after just one use are amazing. I've struggled with cystic acne for 10 years. I've finally started to see a reduction with diet change but the texture of my skin was still awful. No matter what products I tried the texture stayed. Ive also been dealing with big pores and sebaceous filaments that I couldnt get rid of. WELL! With one 20 minute treatment my face is baby butt soft! I havent felt my skin feel like this in years! Also all the sebaceous filaments on my nose disappeared! Anyways just excited! Lol anyone else have a similar experience?

WRITING.TITLE: I used binge eating as a form of self harm and even though ive recovered my body hasn't (PSA/Rant)
WRITING.TEXT: When your in the thick of BED your biggest concern is usually your weight and it makes sense since BED is very much related to our self image problems but at my worst I was so depressed that I was actively trying to use food to end my life. I knew I couldn't do it myself so my thought was I'll eat myself to death. Ill get a disease or something eventually and I can just go "naturally" . I've been in recovery now 8 months and it started by focusing on my mental health...... but guess what....ive spent the last 8 months in recovery for BED and almost a year working on my depression/ other mental illnesses to finally after 7 straight years of hell find some stability and hope for the future. I am finally ready to start living my life again BUT my past still haunts me. I did so much damage to my body especially in the last year of my BED that im not recovering physically. Ive lost 70 pounds and am still loosing. I thought my body would fix itself since ive lost so much weight and am soooo much healthier now but I think the damage may be done. I still have digestive issues even though Ive removed inflammatory foods from my diets, my blood pressure is higher than its ever been even at my heaviest, and my organs are not functioning properly. Im going to test after test because im in constant pain and I just know it's one of my organs thats damaged due to the shit I put it through. When I was at my worst I had to have emergency gall bladder surgery, i had fatty liver disease, and my spleen was enlarged. It all made sense then but why am i still having issues now! After 70 pounds loss and a massive turnaround of my diet? I guess the take away from this is... Forget about your weight. Weight loss can happen and will happen if you recover from BED. You can loose weight at any time though. You always will have time to loose weight but if you keep going the way your going your body may never heal from the damage your doing to it now. You could put in all the hard work and end up recovered but then be like me and still suffering. Place the importance on mental health and physical health because a nice body doesnt matter if you cant do anything because your too sick. You finally have your life back and you can't enjoy it because you've damaged your body beyond repair. Its no joke. Binge eating, gaining tons of weight within a relatively short period, eating unhealthy foods, and continuously going from the "on diet", "off diet" , loose weight, gain weight, cycle is detrimental to your health long term. Im in my early 30's and I have the same health problems my 65 year old mother. Im really praying that whats wrong with me isnt permanently damaged because I finally have hope for the future but my body may have other plans for me. Let me be a cautionary tale. Your BED can cause permanent damage to vital organs. Get proper help. Stop dieting. Stop focusing on weight loss. Focus on mental health so you can recover and get out before its too late.

WRITING.TITLE: Vyvanse is not the answer to your binge eating problem.
WRITING.TEXT: I've seen so many Vyvanse posts lately its incredibly alarming. Binge eating disorder has nothing to do with your appetite an "appetite suppressor" is not going to cure your binge eating disorder. At best it will curb symptoms for a little while at worst you'll have terrible side effects and maybe even become addicted to it because its a derivative of amphetamines. Binge eating disorder is 100% psychological. It is a mental health disorder. Vyvanse has nothing to do with mental health unless you have ADHD. The only reason doctors are prescribing it for binge eating disorder is because it has a side effect of reducing your appetite. You know what other drug has that side effect, crystal meth. Does anyone think crystal meth is going to help their binge eating disorder? Maybe in the short term , not in the long term. Your honestly better off taking an antidepressant for binge eating disorder than Vyvanse. At least an antidepressant has the ability to lift your mood which could help you with your emotional health. People with BED need therapy. They have self image issues and coping skills issues. They need to learn healthy coping skills, learn how to deal emotions effectively and learn how to curb destructive thoughts/beliefs about their self image. None of that will come from a pill im sorry to say. I know it's easier to think about taking a pill a day then spending hours doing the mental hard work of learning and facing emotions but thats the only long term way out i promise you. Taking a pill is not going to stop you from binge eating when you have an extreme emotional response to something. Even if you're not hungry you will eventually binge because that is the only way you know how to cope. You need an overhaul of how your brain thinks and works and Vyvanse is not that. Look at those that post success stories. They all have a similar theme. I stopped dieting, stopped counting, stopped weighing, and focused on my mental health. Ive been in recovery 8 months. Ive lost 70 pounds. All without a diet or exercise purely from therapy. My perspective had to change and i needed to gain the skills to manage my emotions. No pill can do that for you. If you want to beat BED long term therapy is the way. Ive found most success with Dialectical Behavioural Therapy. Its not specific to BED but gives you all the skills you need to start to concur it. CBT is a great therapy as well. There are BED specific programs out there now. They revolve alot around intuitive eating. In my experience a combination of a BED program and DBT or CBT therapy is best. If you are looking for a therapist, psychologist, or social worker try to find one that has training in DBT. That's my suggestion. If you can't get to a therapist. DBT has lots of info online. They have books on amazon. There are binge eating books out there now. You have to attack this from a mental health perspective. The type of food you eat, when you eat, how much you eat, your appetite, your willpower, none of this has to do with the reason you are binge eating. It all has to do with your emotional health. That's where recovery will come from. Edit: i am not knocking vyvanse for ADHD treatment or as treatment in combination with therapy. Nor am I saying other medications cant help with BED. There are many underlining issues that can result in BED. I am saying Vyvanse as your first and ONLY treatment is not going to solve your binge eating issue long term.

WRITING.TITLE: Crumbly Town Software LLC - SCAM
WRITING.TEXT: They are doing a job scam. Offering people remote work. I applied through Indeed in Canada. . I was offered the job of a Team Assistant with no interview. They sent me a contract which I did not open in case of a virus. I asked for a number to contact her to discuss the contract as their supposed telephone number didn't actually link to a real person. I have received no more communication with them since I asked. Before I got "hired" they asked me for my name, number, e-mail, and said the job required a smartphone with a camera and to confirmed I had one. Then they sent me the contract for employment and asked to send a piece of photo ID like a driver's license, birth certificate, or passport (which I did not send). While looking into the company they do have a website but it's covered in spelling and grammatical errors. When I google earthed their address it was a strip mall to which I saw no sign or proof they existed in that area. When you call their number it is an automated message about them providing consultation work and to hold the line to speak to someone at which they play music and no one ever comes on the phone. I found a few LinkedIn profiles of people who had Crumbly Town Software LLC listed as their employment so it seems they did a little extra work to be convincing but when looking up the names of the people I saw on Linkedin, the people I spoke with from the company, and the supposed president of the company I came up with nothing on the internet. No social media, no news, no previous work, these people were all ghosts. They have applied for a business name so they do appear to have registered their business but again I couldn't find any information on the "president". At the time I was researching the company there were no "Scam" indications. It appears someone has picked up on the scam and there is now a scam alert out for them but I wanted to write this to make sure it gets more hits on the internet as they've done a decent job at making the company seem like it may simply be a start-up which would explain it's lack of history online.

Wow some Optometrist clearly did this writer dirty lmao. Ive spent the last 12 years working for optometrists and ophthalmologists in different clinics around the GTA. I can honestly say I have never seen an Optometrist send someone to the emergency room because they simply did not want to treat them due to money. If an Optometrist sends someone to the emergency room its usually because they have a major concern that is time sensitive and needs a specialist or special equipment to get a more accurate diagnoses which many optometrists won't have in house. Some people do get frustrated with optometrists that send them to emergency rooms. Ive seen irate patients come back and yell at a doctor for wasting their time at emergency but this is your eyesight. These doctors don't take it lightly and some eye conditions like a retinal detachment can be extremely time sensitive and if we don't want our patients to go blind we tell them to go to an emergency room. I mean better safe than sorry when it comes to your sight! But of course there are always those that get angry even if youre trying to help. Anyways i truly do not think this is the norm at all. Ive never seen a doctor in any of the practices ive worked at prioritize money over patient care. Does money matter? Of course. Especially doctors who own their own practices but I personally have not seen this money over care mentality and I have worked very closely with a lot of doctors. It just seems like the writer had a shitty experience to me and now wants to generalize the whole industry. It's really a ridiculous article lol.

Go to another Optometrist. Not everyone is good at their job lol. Don't go around with poor vision. You're missing so much of the world. Next time you go to an optometrist look up their google reviews so you can ensure they are professional and kind before you go

Theres two things probably going on here because its similar for me. One: its simply a habit. Like seeing an old friend that used to be a drinking buddy and all you can think about it having a beer now lol. If your mom was a constant source of binging for you its understandable that when you hear her or see her you associate her with your binges. Ive been binge free all through corona and i took my first road trip over the weekend. In the past i would binge whatever i wanted when i was on the road so when i went this time i realized just the trip itself had me craving every fast food place i past because i simply associated road trips with binging now. It was quite difficult not to give in. I think it's important to try not to give in to the urge when you see or talk to your mom. I feel when im able to break that pattern a few times the associate with past habits fades and a new normal develops. Two: You have some feelings about your mom that you havent quite dealt with. This is where therapy comes in or skills training. Learning to separate the feeling from eating, learning how to cope with the emotions you feel when with your mom, and working through some of that baggage. Sounds like some form of therapy whether it be 1 on 1 or skills based like DBT or CBT would be very helpful for you in this situation.

That takes a lot of therapy and maybe alot of meds lol but ultimately when you start to feel better and learn skills that help you cope better this is one of the principals that you will work on and will help with long term recovery. I think though it doesnt come into play until you've already found some stability with mood. I think a lot of these people either werent AS sick to begin with or recovered but forgot what they had to go through before they could even reach a point where they could examine their own self image. A year ago i was at my worst and i thought the exact same thing as you. Now that ive gotten treatment and my life circumstances has allowed me to focus on my mental health I am in the part of recovery where accepting myself as I am is important for my long term mental health but it didn't start off there. I had a lot of shit I had to come to terms with and work through before getting to this "acceptance" phase. It's just a different stage of recovery thats all. Perhaps youre not there yet but one day it may make more sense to you as it did with me.

They absolutely can not. People can only pull from their own experiences. Alot of people compare their depression from a break up or some sad event in their life to our chronic BPD depression. They assume because they got through it we can too. Its not really their fault. All they know is what they felt and alot of people assume what they felt must be similar because its all called "depression". It's ignorant to think that but also it's hard to blame them. Its not their fault they dont understand and people give unwanted or shitty advice because they are trying to help. It always comes off as condescending because they just don't understand the complexities of mental illness. I just had to find a different perspective on it. Instead of being annoyed i just appreciated their attempt to help and if I am close with them ill explain to them that they dont need to give advice i just need someone to listen or perhaps even explain how what they say makes you feel worse.

Ive been twice. It was a necessary restart for me. Being in the ward just allows that time to rest, get meds changed or fixed, and be able to focus on just yourself and your mental health. Being there opens up a lot of doors as well to after care programs which are very important for long term recovery. I mean it's not a good time. No time in a hospital is usually a good time lol. It can be very boring and lonely and there are some very sick people there so you certainly experience the spectrum of mental illness which can be educating but also difficult to cope with. It's not as horrible as movies make it out to be and I think the stigma to it is really outdated. I think if you're severely ill with psychosis or other mind altering issues it can probably be very scary and traumatic and I feel for those people. I was almost committed once without my consent and it was a very different situation to when I voluntarily agreed to be committed. It is not fun when you get the choice taken away from you. It is a very traumatic thing to happen but often it is for your benefit. Overall I have been lucky on the sense that Ive had mostly positive experiences with it.

Exactly why healthcare shouldn't be privatized. I live in canada and truly dont know how people do it. I honestly dont think i would have survived in an American health system. Its no wonder so many go untreated there. The medicine is pretty standard practice. It is ridiculous because its brand new medicine and you dont get a choice in the matter. Most of the time its a sedative like seroquel or something which in itself is ridiculous because its an antipsychotic and really shouldn't just be pushed on someone before they have your attending doctors review your drugs but everytime ive been there they do push some sort of sedating medicine on you and i think thats just to make you sleep, keep you calm, and shut you up so you can settle in lol. Its not cool but Unfortuently common practice. And its also common practice to do check ins often. It's a liability issue. It does seem like it would be more important to let people get their sleep but a lot if these ppl are there for fear of harm to themselves so they need to ensure they are in bed, asleep, and yes adjusting to the medication okay.

Salicylic and benzoyl are both very stripping. I agree that you should use one or the other or at least one in the morning one at night but i would not recommend using those together. Niacinamide can usually be mixed fine with most ingredients but it can be a little drying as well so using back to back with the other ingredients may be a little over kill. Make sure to moisturizer no matter what you do. I used salicylic acid for a long time and no moisturizer because i was worried it would cause clog my pores and cause more acne. It also felt good to have the oil off my face. Well it helped in the short term but not the long term as without moisture my skin was producing more oil and basically keeping my acne going. Once i started using moisturizer my face produced a lot less oil and is a lot more manageable now.

I got it under control. Had BED for 18 years. Last year I got up to 300lbs which was my heaviest. Between 14-25 i yo-yo'd between 130 and 200. Up and down constantly. At 25 I started going up and couldn't get it back down like i had before. Struggled HARD for the last 7 years with BED and other issues. This year I finally got it under control and have lost 70lbs and counting. It started with getting my other mental health issues under control first. I have BPD. Many people with BED have an underlining disorder whether that be ADHD, BPD, BD, MDD, OCD, PTSD, I mean so many thing can have a side effect of BED. It's not always the case but its a good thing to explore if you haven't had a proper mental health assessment i would give that a try because you could be missing a big piece of the puzzle. I did go to an eating disorder program as well and it did not help me either because I was struggling with other issues and the fact that my BED was rooted from other things made stuff like intuitive eating and all that useless. It wasnt until I was able to understand why i binged ( ineffective coping mechanism for extreme emotions) that then lead to my recovery. I was put in a DBT program for my BPD. The DBT program is great for my other illnesses but also exactly what i needed for BED. I think even if you dont have BPD, DBT or CBT is a more well rounded program then one that focuses soley on the disorder and thats because it deals with the reason for the disorder and not just the symptoms of the disorder. Anyways im in recovery 9 months now and for the first time in a healthy sustainable way. It is possible but man can it take time and ALOT of perseverance to find the thing that finally works for you or just clicks in mentally.

I felt like that last year too. It just seemed never ending. I was completely hopeless. I was sure my life would never get better and I prayed everyday for it to end. It's really tough man I get it. The only thing you can do is to keep trying. Keep looking for programs, keep speaking with doctors, i know when youve tried everything it seems hopeless but there are lots of people out there that never thought it would get better, me included, and it did. Perhaps you need to put the BED aside and focus on your general mental health. If youve got to the point of having suicidal thoughts there is something else going on whether its depression or another disorder that could be the key to your BED recovery. If you havent already get a mental health assessment, see if youve got anything else going on and treat that first. BED is a lot easier to treat when your mood is more elevated and you've tackled the root cause.

If you want an eye exam covered typically, yes, there does have to be some obvious signs of an issue. Redness, inflammation, etc. Thats the only way doctors can get it covered is if the eye exam is for health reasons. If there doesn't seem to be a clear issue then a lot will ask for payment because it wont be covered by OHIP otherwise. Now if you do pay and they do find something medically wrong with your eye they should refund you the money and then put it through OHIP but adults know eye exams are not covered unless medically nescessary. Thats OHIPs rule. If every optometrist saw everyone that claimed to have something wrong with their eye with no clear physical indication then everyone would come in and say that just to have a free exam. The doctors can't bill it to OHIP unless there is a suspected issues or a diagnoses. Doctors do need to get paid yes. Just like a dentist wont see you unless you pay. Its because OHIP doesnt cover it. That's an OHIP problem not an Optometrist problem. Optometrists will never turn someone away and this whole article is misleading if "turned away" just means you were unwilling to pay and wanted free care. Well unfortunately eye care isnt free in this country and it needs to be paid by OHIP or by the patient but the doctors arent turning you away you chose to go to the hospital because you didnt want to pay an appointment fee thats different than being turned away for service. You weren't turned away for service. They offered you service and you declined it.

Totally understandable because you hear so much about it but there are clearly families with more than 1 child lol. I saw families of 4 often. To be fair the policy did end in 2016 and many of the children i taught were young and had younger siblings so its very possible that their siblings were born after the policy was changed BUT shit happens and lots of people had more than 1 child in China before the policy changed. Often the penalty was a fine. So if you made decent money or had savings you could just pay the fine. A lot of people simply didnt register their other children because they couldnt afford the fine which had become a big problem on its own. The children basically didnt exist to the government so they often couldnt get schooling, healthcare, and finding a job was difficult. Now that the policy has changed i believe these "invisible" children are allowed to be registered without a fine but yeah i was genuinely shocked too when i saw most chinese students i worked with were a household of 4. Im pretty sure thats why i ended up looking into it because i was surprised all my students had siblings lol.

Most recently i was on 2 antidepressants and a sleep med. Wellbutrin, sertraline, and zopiclone. I stopped taking sertraline and actually felt better. I was having side effects i didnt even realize which can be an issue with taking so many meds. You start knowing whats causing what lol. Im also reducing my sleeping pill now as i have had some recovery of symptoms while being in a DBT program. So soon ill be down to just 1 med which is a little weird for me. I usually am on a minimum of 2 lol. Im thinking i may need to add some sort of antianxiety in there but i guess we'll see. Its hard to say if you are on too many pills. It's all up to you and what you feel you need for your symptoms. I personally listen to my gut when i think ive been prescribed too much or prescribed the wrong thing. Ive never gone wrong listening to that gut when it comes to medication. I always regret when i ignore it as it usually ends up leading to suffering. Doctors dont feel what you feel so if you feel you are on too many medications or feel you arent benefiting from one or feel there must be another medication that could replace 2 of them i would speak up for sure. If you have a feeling its too much then i think you should listen to that and discuss it with your doctor.

I wouldn't say its insulting. People have different experiences and something you may view as a little sad may be the most sadness theyve ever felt. I do think people over use the term depressed but you tend not to take it seriously when someone says " omg i dropped my hot dog im so depressed" or something dumb like that lol. I think the thing that gets to people with diagnosed mental illness the most is when people try to give you advice or relate their "depression" to yours. That's when it can feel condescending or frustrating and usually not helpful at all because there is a big difference between clinical depression/ mental illness and someone who has felt episodic depression but isn't actually chronically ill.

1. You could just allow yourself to binge. Just accept that when you make cookies you know you are going to eat a lot and you are okay with that. Give yourself permission to enjoy them and to not feel guilty about it. Fact is if you are going to bake and binge you minus well allow yourself the freedom to do so, so you can at least enjoy the moment and reduce the risk of a rebound binge because you've made yourself upset about the cookie binge. Recovery doesnt start with an instant stop to binging. It starts with a change in perspective. A change in the way you treat yourself and a change in the way you attack the problem. Instead of shame and guilt bring kindness and be non-judgemental towards yourself. Being kinder is a big step. Eating a lot of cookies isnt the end of the world but youre right that doing this often and for a long time could hurt your health but recovery wont come if you beat yourself up everytime you eat something you think you shouldn't. When i started allowing myself to eat without shaming myself it actually became easier not to binge. As crazy as that sounds. 2. Again binge the cookies lol but perhaps make them with different ingredients so they are 1) healthier 2) less addicting. If they are for someone else make them a batch of regular ones and you a batch of the healthier version so you can still eat and enjoy but wont have as much consequence health wise for doing so. I also find typical cookies are much more addictive than healthier versions therefore i eat less.

Yeah im sure it feels that way and im not trying to dismiss your feelings but binge eating typically happens for a reason and often we can't see it because we aren't aware of it. I mean if you think back to when you started binge eating or to when it really became a problem or to when you started again, what was going on? People over eat sure but binge eating is often a loss of control due to having emotions we dont know how to cope with. Binge eating can definitely feel like the problem and can definitely cause or have an effect on depression but binge eating is usually a symptom of something. Its a coping tool just like drugs or drinking is for others. Yes many people are alcoholics and are depressed because they are alcoholics but something lead to their alcoholism. Theyre using alcohol as a coping mechanism because they cant effectively handle whatever it is that leads them to drinking. Food is the same to us as drugs are to a drug addicts. People who recover from addictions need mental health care to learn why they cope this way and how to avoid it. Unfortunetly we need food to survive so in a sense it can be even harder to find recovery because we cant straight up abstain from food. It takes a lot of mental skills to figure it out but I would bet that there is some emotion or something linked to the binge eating that you just havent quite figured out yet. I didnt realize either. I truly just thought i was fat and lazy. Even when they told me i had a disorder i still thought to myself nah i just have no will power but eventually i learned how to recognize what emotions i was feeling, name them, and eventually realized my binging was linked go my emotions but it wasnt an overnight realization.

WRITING.TITLE: Job seekers beware of Indeed. An incredible number of jobs scams right now.
WRITING.TEXT: I have been on Indeed for years and never had a problem with scammers. In the last week I've received 4 fake job offers. It's been incredibly hard to find a job during this pandemic. I am a hard working, very skilled worker, with lots of experience and scammers are trying to target me. Frankly I am not going to use Indeed anymore because they seem to have more scams than Craigslist at this point but I wanted to warn everyone to do their homework vigilantly before accepting any job offers from Indeed. You may be better off finding another job portal to use or apply with the company directly. Just wanted to warn everyone the scammers are out and they do cover their bases so its not as easy to spot as it once was.

WRITING.TITLE: If working, how much can you make before you are cut off from ODSP completely?
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry I am sure this has been answered but I have scrolled through and can't see it. I know if you work part time they take 50% dollar for dollar but at what point do they stop and say you make too much now? I saw it says they will stop if you are no longer financially eligible but doesn't explain what amount of money that is? I am thinking about trying to work part time. I don't mind the reduction in money if i do i think thats fair but what if I make too much with the part time job, loose my benefits, and can't make ends meet because i am unable to work full time? Anyone have the answer? Thank you

Well they are. I mean that's why ive caught all of them but some are getting more sophisticated and a lot of people don't research before accepting positions. You also don't assume there are a ton of scammers on Indeed. I didn't anyways, it always seemed like a pretty legit site but obviously anyone can post if they pay and I guess these guys are willing to pay. It's also just frustrating when you're spending your time applying for jobs that are scams. That's why i'm just giving up on Indeed all together and going to another site that is more vigilant with their monitoring.

Oh okay i see so basically you'd have to make double what you are getting from ODSP to be removed. I think my math is right on that? Lol. Oh well yeah at that point it would make sense to be able to support yourself i suppose lol. Okay thank you!

I gotta say i really feel for men with BPD. First I know how difficult it is for women to get properly diagnosed with this disorder but for men I just can see how it would be extremely difficult getting a proper diagnoses. Ive been in quite a few BPD clinics now and it does seem the men have a particularly hard time with it. Not only are they often out numbered by women so I think that can add to a discomfort but since men do have a more difficult time opening up I can really see their struggle. Out off all the DBT programs ive done I think I saw one man complete the whole program the rest dropped out and it just hurt my soul to see that. I wish I was a braver person as I really wanted to talk to them and encourage them to stick it out but of course I just empathize from afar but I really do feel for you. This illness is a fucking bitch but I acknowledge how hard it must be for men. I can see how you could get very discouraged from seeking help. My advice would just be to try to stick it out. The more men that seek help and stick out treatment the more it will normalize it and hopefully we can get better treatment for men. Everything you said above us exactly how I feel almost to a T and I am a woman. Genders definitely experience things differently but with this disorder its very similar in both sexes. Hopefully you can find a program that can help you out because DBT programs have really helped me alot.

Theres a lot of different scams. The problem is these are remote jobs. With the pandemic I am unable to work around people due to autoimmune problems. I know there are a lot of legit remote jobs right now but maybe even more fake ones. Since it's remote you don't actually end up going anywhere for an interview. The fake jobs are not hard to spot. If its a real remote job they should at the very least have a video interview with you which a lot of the scams will not do. Theyll often just review your resume and offer you a job which is why its so clear its bogus but some people have been doing telephone interviews and being offered jobs that were scams too. I'm more pissed off that im wasting my time applying for jobs and they end up being scams. I don't necessarily want to vet every job i apply to. I do that if they contact me but just to apply i dont want to have to constantly be researching if its legit but on indeed especially it seems thats what needs to be done which is why im just over indeed now.
Hahaha! If it were only that easy lol

I know me either! I duno if they have less staff that the scams are able to slip through easier or more scammers because ppl are looking for online work but for some reason there's a big issue now. I even saw an article about it on CBC a few days ago and the woman scammed found the job on indeed too. As to what ill start using now... The jobbank.gc.ca site is okay. It's a government website so more likely to be accurate. There's also monster and workopolis but i dont have much luck finding stuff in my field on those sites. I think I'm just going to start applying directly to companies i want to work with. Its tough though itll take more effort from me for sure lol. Indeed does offer so many options but when 4/10 jobs i applied for this week were fake its just such a waste of my time. I mean one job was for an actual company that exists. They put the businesses real website and the guys real telephone number but the guy didn't post the ad. I got an email from some random to give them my information so they could continue the hiring process. I mean so you could look into a company and it be completely real but its just a cover. Im just so over it. I just have no faith in Indeed anymore.
I heard LinkedIn is really awful for scams.

Well most of the scams ive run into are for remote work. That's what ive been applying for and that definitely is the easiest to fake so if you are looking for remote work have your guard up right away. If they offer you a job right away its fake lol. I found if they email you and ask you to send them your name,email, and phone number. Its fake too. Since Indeed hides your real e-mail and telephone number I assume that's why they ask so they don't have to communicate through indeed anymore. If they don't call you for a telephone interview fake. Some have been doing telephone interviews but most companies are going to want to do a video interview if they are serious about hiring you so if your hired after 1 phone call I would look more deeply into it. After all those obvious things its just a quick google search and you'll start noticing some suspicious stuff. Ill list the common stuff I see below: 1. The address of their company isnt on google maps. Meaning when you google their address and go to street view you'll find a strip mall, or house, or random building that clearly they do not work out of 2. If you call their number there isnt actually a human that answers the phone 3. Alot will have websites but they'll be pretty basic and will likely have grammatical or spelling errors. 4. If you google their company name and nothing comes up but 1 website. Also they do tend to register their business name so if you google their name and see their registration come up it's usually a very new business created within the last few months. 5. You cant find ANYONE that you've spoken with from this company on social media or any other sites. This one job i googled the "hr" person who listed the job, the "manager" who hired me, and their supposed president and got not 1 hit for any of these people. This particular scam went as far as to make fake LinkedIn profiles that had 2 or 3 separate ppl list this company as a current job but the linkedin profiles had no photo, no connections, and also they were ghosts on the internet. Some scammers really do go through some trouble lol. 6. If you still haven't figured if they are fake they will eventually ask you for something. Credit card, bank info, SIN number. Etc. At this point if you still have a suspicion but havent been able to prove it don't give them anything. Ask to speak with them because you have some questions. Typically they will stop responding if you show your are wary. If they do talk to you make sure to ask lots of questions to see if they are able to answer all of them confidently and maybe even request a video call. 7. Sometimes simply googling "company name + scam" will answer your question. They are popping up fast. Faster than i think ppl can keep up with but it could be a very easy way to rule them out. As for other websites for me ive been using the canadian job bank website more. Jobbank.gc.ca and looking on indeed to see what companies are hiring and applying directly to them instead of through indeed.

Its probably not the act of fasting but the removal or reduction in an inflammatory or triggering food you are eating. There is something to be said too about how fasting may effect insulin levels which can reduce your blood sugar and may have an effect on your skin due to its effect on hormones. I'm more inclined to say its the food thing and you probably have foods you are unaware of that are a trigger for you but the insulin argument is valid as well. I would explore the food option as its more sustainable to remove certain foods from your diet than to intermittently fast for the rest of your life but yeah these seem like 2 likely reasons.

I have a rescue as well and I see similar patterns in her. When you get a rescue you really are committing to a possible life of issues. You cant guarantee that the rescue is going to know all of their issues and their issues can change once they are rehomed. I mean its kind of what you sign up for when adopting a rescue thats why people that adopt rescues are so special. They are willing to do what they need to do and clearly you have. I too have put a lot of work into my rescue paid for training, dog walkers, day care, etc etc. But I do find new things pop up for her often. Ive had her 2 years now and shes overall better than she was but ill have the same experience where ill train her to do something shell be fine for a few months then all of a sudden its like the training went out the window or shes developed this new bad habit. I duno what it is. If its a rescue thing. Its just like shes consistent until shes not lol. It is very strange and ive had moments where I just break down because I feel like a shit owner and that she would probably be better off with someone else but the fact that we care enough to keep trying and keep researching and trying to keep accommodating well i think thats alot more than a lot of ppl would do and makes me think that I am indeed giving her a good home. I dont really have much advice for you because it seems like youre doing the same thing I am. You train, things get better, but then something else comes up and you have to train again or try to find a different solution. It's very similar to what I am experiencing as well and I dont really know if you can do much more about it but what you are doing. Changing up trainers and getting personal trainers may be beneficial as they may have different methods to try with your dog, but of course that gets expensive. The good thing is it will usually pass as you train but of course you have to go through the stress of it. My hope is as she continues to get older shell settle more and our bond will continue to grow. Ive had her 2 years and still feel like the bond is a work in progress. Rescue dogs can take a lot of time to trust. I will say I fenced in my yard when covid happened as we couldn't go to the dog parks anymore and i do think its helped her. We go out in the back yard everyday and play fetch. Even if only for 10 minutes it helps exert energy and gives her that time to roam the yard freely. I also have a long leash I use when we go to like a field or something where i know the place and she can also feel like she had a little more freedom. She used to be a street dog so i know she appreciates being able to explore a little more. I think just continue to follow your gut. If you think your dog needs something youre probably right. And just hang in there. It can be really difficult going through the hard times but I find those times are become fewer and farther apart as we progress and I think thats common to see.

Yes they offer ppl a job without an interview. Indeed hides your email and phone number if you are applying with the indeed resume. If you upload your own resume they obviously they will have your information. Jobs will need your information eventually but if you received an email or message from a company with a basic " give us your name, number, email" its prob a scam. Most employers are going to be more professional than that and if they like your resume will set up an interview. Giving your email and phone isn't going to give them much to work off of so i wouldnt worry about that it's more of just an indication if someone contacts you like that its a scam. Usually if you google the business name if they've registered the name it will come up. When i searched all of the fake jobs it was like the 3rd or 4th result on google. It'll be like a state registration or provincial or national business registration something like that. Just click the link and it will tell you when it was incorporated. Most of them will be within the last few months. One that was harder to tell was one that was started in 2017. This was the one that did all the fake profiles n stuff. I did think maybe its just a start up as they did label themselves as a small company and posting on job searches geared to start up companies . i was skeptical but was thinking it could be real but when you really dig in theres just too many iffy things about it and ultimately even if they are a start up the lack of info online about the company or even the ppl involved is just too suspicious. I understand the frustration as indeed really is easy to use and has a lot of diversity with jobs. WRITING.TITLE: Anyone ever had swollen lymph nodes as a symptom of a flare up?
WRITING.TEXT: Last week I noticed a tender spot under my chin. Felt like a cyst or something. The next day the lymph nodes under my chin and jaw we're all swollen. Along with hot flashes, fatigue, headache, and just a feeling of general unwellness, like I was fighting off something. I did go do a covid test even though I have been quarantined since march but I went just in case. It was negative. The next day after I felt unwell I felt fine except the swollen lymphs were still there. It took about a week for them to go down but they did and im back to normal and feel fine now. The reason im wondering if this is linked to HS is because I ate a major trigger food that I shouldnt have. The feelings of getting sick are common with me if I eat this food but the nodes are new. I feel like it would be very weird if it were connected but I thought id asked since I have no idea what else could have caused it.
Imagine if your job was the guy digging that stuff all day. Damn can you say back problems.

WRITING.TITLE: Daiya Pizza surprisingly good! Gluten free, dairy free.
WRITING.TEXT: Just thought id give a little shoutout to this pizza that I tried the other day and was pleasantly surprised with. I tried the Margherita flavour. Its gluten free, dairy free, soy free, plant based. My triggers are dairy, sugar, and high fat so ive had to remove alot of tasty food from my diet like pizza but sometimes you just want a damn pizza! Lol. Anyways i thought id try this vegan pizza and see how it went for me. Well I'm happy to say it was great. It tasted great, was more filling than regular pizza, and I had no flare ups associated with it. Not even an IBS flare up! so this is my official go to pizza if I'm feeling like a bit of a treat. Just thought id share because i understand the struggle of not being able to eat anything yummy lol. Warning: it does have tomatoes so those of you with nightshade triggers this unfortunately may not be an option. It is also not a "healthy option" lol. Just want to put out there that it does have a lot of fat, sodium, and calories so its not a healthy alternative to pizza its just an alternative to pizza for those that have intolerances to dairy, or gluten.

My dog has allergies to almost all proteins. i tried her on so many different foods it was hard to figure out. She had skin issues, ear infections, bowel issues and the vet also didn't take it very seriously. Allergies can cause so many issues but some doctors don't see it as a big deal. Anyways after a ton of different commerical foods and vet foods I finally found Raynes Low Fat Kangaroo food which sold through vets. It's more expensive but when your dog has issues that keep warranting vet visits its ALOT cheaper in the long run. Almost immediately her issues started to disappear. Now she has no signs of allergies at all. Her skin turned from purple and scabby to a healthy pink. She grew hair in places she was bald. She has almost no wax in her ears anymore. Her bowels are regular and normal. Her coat is very thick, full, and soft. Even her nose looks better lol. It was like magic. Im so happy i found this food. They have treats as well.

First of all its going to be the hardest time EVER to get a dog from a shelter because SOOOO many people are adopting because they have more time due to covid. So it's like the worst time to try to adopt. I mean for the first time ever shelters had no dogs. Its unheard of! Thats what you're up against for local shelters. There are international rescues that are great, where i got my dog from, because even before covid rescuing locally was hard but since flights are reduced and borders are closed thats not a quick option either. I know when you decide to get a dog you want one now but its honestly best to wait. Keep applying and looking at different areas but know that its probably going to be difficult until covid is done. There are ALOT of puppy mills and shitty breeders popping up taking advantage of this lack of availability. If you really are a person that wants to rescue i wouldnt add to the problem. I know its hard but If you wait it will be easier and you can get a legitimate rescue that needs your help and a good home. Shelters are going to start dealing with ppl bringing back animals. It always happens when these mass adoptions happen. So keep trying but keep your expectations low that as it could be a while before you get a dog. You may also want to sign up with different places for foster care. That will allow you to have a chance with the dogs when they first come in and usually you'll have first pick if you want to keep them.

Ugh this is why i adopted internationally from a rescue charity. Local shelters are insane with their standards. I appreciate them making the effort to place in a good home but theyve become impossible to please. I provide my dog with an AMAZING home and lifestyle. Like its legit the best for my dog i spare no cost but according to local shelters I didnt have what it took to adopt a dog. Fulltime worker, single, lived in an apartment, first time dog owner. No one wanted to give me a dog lol even though I was already prepared to pay for training, i had a dog walker and daycare in place for lunch time walks and play, and I lived 5 minutes away from 3 different dog parks. When I reached out to a rescue that worked internationally they were very excited with everything I had in place and saw that what I was offering was better than what the dogs current situation was. I mean isn't that what matters. Like you said they get a wonderful home. Instead they prefer to keep them in a cage. It really makes no sense to me and i hear this ALL the time about local shelters.

I don't agree with that. I think everyone who has trained should get an equal chance. This doesn't just happen with fire fighters though. That happens with any career that's competitive. I agree it shouldnt be like that however it doesnt change the fact that all those ppl may die doing the job and the pay should reflect the risk.

Texting in general for ppl with BPD is not ideal lol. Unfortunately that's how everyone wants to communicate these days. I would say there may be some changes you could make to help reduce your distress. Talk to him about not doing that. Tell him you understand it may mean hes just busy but it would be really helpful for you if he messaged you back right away or perhaps doesnt read it until he has the time to msg you back so you dont start worrying. Dont blame him just say its something you need for you. Dont message on a system that you can see read or not. Maybe stick to regular text message or if you can turn off that setting. I have an android so if i text regularly i cant see if its been read or not. Agree to just communicate through phone calls. Its not an easy option as many people dont like doing that anymore but hes your bf so maybe hell be down with knowing the best way to communicate with you is phone call. DBT interpersonal skills have some good ways to get you through situations like this.

Yes very very very hard for me. I have an event this weekend and got a dog walker just for that day because i felt bad leaving her for probably not more than 5 or 6 hours lol but it throws off her schedule. The walker ended up cancelling so i said forget it i should be able to leave her for a few hours lol but I already feel guilty and know im going to feel bad when im gone. It is a little bit ridiculous lol. Shes perfectly fine alone but I just feel immense guilt lol. Especially since covid we havent been apart for more than 2 hours lol. I also have a camera that ive set up to check in on her. It helps and doesnt lol. I probably check it too much but does feel good just seeing her chilling being fine lol. Maybe an option for you. Lots of cheap ones on amazon and you just download an app and can see them on your phone in real time.
Not cool

DBT absolutely made the difference between me just surviving and me getting my life back. Medication brings me to a point where I stay alive but DBT teaches me how to deal with this world and gave me the skills needed to thrive in this world. I think remission needs to be a perfect mixture of meds, therapy, and life circumstances but DBT is truly vital in BPD because the disorder is really based around emotional dysregulation and DBT is the only therapy that addresses that. Its a program specifically made for BPD and you can tell it is because it really speaks to a lot of issues we deal with on a day to day. Ive done the dbt program twice so it doesnt mean its going to cure you but especially this last round really helped put my symptoms into remission I have been on a lot of meds. Wellbutrin has been the one that has lasted the longest for me with the least amount of side effects.

You think everyone in a fire gets out on their own? You think firefighters die because theyre sat twiddling their thumbs. Its ridiculous to say. Every life saving service is important and we would be in big trouble if they weren't around.

No way!!! I mean i totally get lymph nodes in the groin and arm pit swelling because those are active areas for HS but thought i was being far fetched that it could affect my neck. I actually cant believe this. Thank you so much for responding because I was low key starting to worry it might be cancer or something too lol. I feel a lot better knowing someone else with HS has experienced this and its not as far fetched as i thought lol. Thats insane though. Ive had swelling in other areas but to affect those nodes that are commonly swollen from like a viral or bacterial infection is kind of insane to me. I mean thats how much our body is fighting. Thats nuts. Thats a huge body response for this stupid condition. Its really crazy to me there is so little available to help us, medically speaking, when our bodies take such a beating.

Its really hard with alot of inflammtory/autoimmune diseases. There doesnt seem to be very clear ways of diagnosing. I often wonder if ive got something else going on but my symptoms never quite match all the tell tale signs so I figure its prob just the HS. I too do better eating clean. The reason I think I had this flare up was because I ate 2 chocolate type desserts. Things I havent eaten in over 7 months. I expected to have a flare up but not like this. Not in a part of the body that really isnt effected by HS and not so severely. This was certainly new for me and is kinda freaking me out that HS can effect my whole system so greatly but it is what it is. Guess i really cant eat chocolate anymore #128557;

No ones comparing. You are the only one comparing. I think they are all vital services and there is no point in comparing because if we lost any of those services we would be fucked. I dont really care if firefighters do nothing most of the time because the fact is i may need them to save my house or my life one day and im more than happy with my tax paying dollars going to life savers then to other wasteful things it goes to.

I honestly have no idea lol. I just had to let mine run its course. I took Tylenol for the pain and just tried to keep myself comfortable. I was thinking about going to the doctor because i really thought it was an infection of some sort but with covid i figured ill wait a few days and if its still here ill go but day by day it felt better. It still took a week to finally go down but yeah im perfectly fine now. I would say other than a pain reliever try to help your body by eating cleaner. Less inflammatory foods will help to not cause any worse inflammation and just lots of liquids and sleep. Kind of just the normal stuff you do when you are sick because really thats what it is. Your body acts like its fighting off something so it goes all nuts with inflammation lol. Ive heard bra pads or shoulder pads can be really nice to put under your arm for cushion. I havent tried it but ive read some ppl do that. Ice will also help with swelling and pain.

Its pretty common with HS unfortunately so nothing really to worry about. Just keep an eye on it because infections can happen but typically it looks worse than it medically is. It'll likely reduce on its on. If it hasn't gone down in a weeks time then have it looked at just to make sure nothing else is going on.

No problem! There are some things you can do to help relieve symptoms like shampooing with an antifungal/antibacterial shampoo. They are good for skin conditions. Vets usually sell them or you can look on amazon for one. You can also buy a hotspot foam or an anti itch spray. Those will help relieve some inflammation and dryness that can cause itching. Her paws may have a yeast issue. Thats what commonly causes licking and redness. You can use the shampoo for this or i know there are some at home remedies like a vinegar mix you have them step into. Something you can research. All of these things though are just helping the symptoms not getting to the cause of the problem. I would definitely try a dietary change as food allergies are very common now and often linked to skin issues. Goodluck!

Food allergies! My dog had same issue. Switched to novel protein and everything cleared up. Skin went from purple to light pink, hair grew back, coat was fuller and softer, it was really a transformation all from a diet change. I ended up changing her to Kangaroo but sometimes even a change to fish ,duck, or deer will do it but those didnt work for my dog. Still too commerical i guess lol so I finally landed on Raynes low fat kangaroo which is sold through vets. It was like a miracle food. Even the specific allergy foods didnt work as well as this food does. So now shes kangaroo all the way. Even eats kangaroo treats.

WRITING.TITLE: After being accepted how long was it before they contacted you to set everything up?
WRITING.TEXT: I got a letter in the mail saying my ODSP application was accepted and to wait for someone from a local office to call me. I assume this is when they set up all your benefits and allowance amount since the letter didn't specify the amount I would be receiving. I am wondering how long this typically takes? Are we talking a few days, weeks, months? Lol. CERB is done and ODSP came at a very good time for me but only if it gets started in the next few weeks or else ill be tapped out. The letter doesn't say how long this could take so I am wondering if anyone has experience waiting to be called.

Taking photos lol and I know that seems ridiculous as everyone takes photos but in highschool i was always the person with the camera, on every trip I was the person with the camera, some of my friends only pictures on social media were from me and my picture taking lol. I loved taking photos because i have a terrible memory and taking photos really helps me to remember the moment. Well then all of a sudden social media blew up and everyone is taking photos of everything. Where photos were once beautiful snap shots of a vacation they've now turned into posed, strategic photo ops. The camera used to be a tool I used to capture spontaneous moments, and beautiful sights I wanted to remember. It was a tool to enhance your experience. To bring those moments home with you. Now the camera IS the experience. Now everyone takes photos of fucking everything and nothing is spontaneous. Most people spend their trips just trying to get the perfect picture instead of enjoying their trip and getting the perfect picture because it was a snap shot of that trip. Its kind of ruined picture taking for me. Where i was once excited to be the photog and provide my friends and family with nice pictures I am actually put off my photo taking. It's turned into this narcissistic tool instead of the intended purpose which is supposed to be memories. Everyone's lives revolve around photos now for all the wrong reasons. I feel like I can't be that way anymore because I just look like the rest of the zombies taking photos for social media when in fact I was doing it before it was cool lol.
